chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: To the chief Musician for the sons of Korah, Maschil.
items.plainText: To the chief Musician for the sons of Korah, Maschil.

items.text: We have heard with our ears, O God, our fathers have told us, what work thou didst in their days, in the times of old.
items.plainText: We have heard with our ears, O God, our fathers have told us, what work thou didst in their days, in the times of old.

items.text: How thou didst drive out the heathen with thy hand, and plantedst them; how thou didst afflict the people, and cast them out.
items.plainText: How thou didst drive out the heathen with thy hand, and plantedst them; how thou didst afflict the people, and cast them out.

items.text: For they got not the land in possession by their own sword, neither did their own arm save them: but thy right hand, and thine arm, and the light of thy countenance, because thou hadst a favour unto them.
items.plainText: For they got not the land in possession by their own sword, neither did their own arm save them: but thy right hand, and thine arm, and the light of thy countenance, because thou hadst a favour unto them.

items.text: Thou art my King, O God: command deliverances for Jacob.
items.plainText: Thou art my King, O God: command deliverances for Jacob.

items.text: Through thee will we push down our enemies: through thy name will we tread them under that rise up against us.
items.plainText: Through thee will we push down our enemies: through thy name will we tread them under that rise up against us.

items.text: For I will not trust in my bow, neither shall my sword save me.
items.plainText: For I will not trust in my bow, neither shall my sword save me.

items.text: But thou hast saved us from our enemies, and hast put them to shame that hated us.
items.plainText: But thou hast saved us from our enemies, and hast put them to shame that hated us.

items.text: In God we boast all the day long, and praise thy name for ever. Selah.
items.plainText: In God we boast all the day long, and praise thy name for ever. Selah.

items.text: But thou hast cast off, and put us to shame; and goest not forth with our armies.
items.plainText: But thou hast cast off, and put us to shame; and goest not forth with our armies.

items.text: Thou makest us to turn back from the enemy: and they which hate us spoil for themselves.
items.plainText: Thou makest us to turn back from the enemy: and they which hate us spoil for themselves.

items.text: Thou hast given us like sheep appointed for meat; and hast scattered us among the heathen.
items.plainText: Thou hast given us like sheep appointed for meat; and hast scattered us among the heathen.

items.text: Thou sellest thy people for nought, and dost not increase thy wealth by their price.
items.plainText: Thou sellest thy people for nought, and dost not increase thy wealth by their price.

items.text: Thou makest us a reproach to our neighbours, a scorn and a derision to them that are round about us.
items.plainText: Thou makest us a reproach to our neighbours, a scorn and a derision to them that are round about us.

items.text: Thou makest us a byword among the heathen, a shaking of the head among the people.
items.plainText: Thou makest us a byword among the heathen, a shaking of the head among the people.

items.text: My confusion is continually before me, and the shame of my face hath covered me,
items.plainText: My confusion is continually before me, and the shame of my face hath covered me,

items.text: For the voice of him that reproacheth and blasphemeth; by reason of the enemy and avenger.
items.plainText: For the voice of him that reproacheth and blasphemeth; by reason of the enemy and avenger.

items.text: All this is come upon us; yet have we not forgotten thee, neither have we dealt falsely in thy covenant.
items.plainText: All this is come upon us; yet have we not forgotten thee, neither have we dealt falsely in thy covenant.

items.text: Our heart is not turned back, neither have our steps declined from thy way;
items.plainText: Our heart is not turned back, neither have our steps declined from thy way;

items.text: Though thou hast sore broken us in the place of dragons, and covered us with the shadow of death.
items.plainText: Though thou hast sore broken us in the place of dragons, and covered us with the shadow of death.

items.text: If we have forgotten the name of our God, or stretched out our hands to a strange god;
items.plainText: If we have forgotten the name of our God, or stretched out our hands to a strange god;

items.text: Shall not God search this out? for he knoweth the secrets of the heart.
items.plainText: Shall not God search this out? for he knoweth the secrets of the heart.

items.text: Yea, for thy sake are we killed all the day long; we are counted as sheep for the slaughter.
items.plainText: Yea, for thy sake are we killed all the day long; we are counted as sheep for the slaughter.

items.text: Awake, why sleepest thou, O Lord? arise, cast us not off for ever.
items.plainText: Awake, why sleepest thou, O Lord? arise, cast us not off for ever.

items.text: Wherefore hidest thou thy face, and forgettest our affliction and our oppression?
items.plainText: Wherefore hidest thou thy face, and forgettest our affliction and our oppression?

items.text: For our soul is bowed down to the dust: our belly cleaveth unto the earth.
items.plainText: For our soul is bowed down to the dust: our belly cleaveth unto the earth.

items.text: Arise for our help, and redeem us for thy mercies' sake.
items.plainText: Arise for our help, and redeem us for thy mercies' sake.
